intro: Seseli wawrae, commonly known as Wawra's seseli, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its tall, slender stems and small, clustered white or greenish flowers. The plant has finely divided, fern-like leaves that are often hairy to the touch. Native to the mountainous regions of the eastern Mediterranean, it thrives in rocky and well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
